COFFEE CHIFFON CAKE
2 eggs, separated
1 ½ c. sifted cake flour
1 t. baking powder
1 ½ t. salt
½ c. cold strong Kona coffee
⅓ c. milk
⅛ t. baking soda
2 e. vanilla powder
2 T. salad oil
Beat egg whites until foamy; gradually beat in sifted sugar. Beat until stiff and glossy.

In the remaining sugar, flour, baking powder and salt together. Make a well in center of dry ingredients. Combine coffee, milk, baking soda and vanilla. Add salad oil and one-half the coffee mixture to dry ingredients; beat in mixture at medium speed of 150 strokes by hand. Add remaining coffee mixture and egg yolks and beat additional minutes.

Fold egg whites into batter gently but thoroughly. Pour into two greased and floured 8-inch layer pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Remove from pans; cool. Fill and frost with any notable frosting. Yield: 8-10 servings.
